techmeme.title: The crypto industry, heavily reliant on Telegram, has been Pavel Durov's loudest defender after his arrest; the Telegram-linked TON coin has a $13.7B market cap (David Yaffe-Bellany/New York Times)
Sources: ex-Intel board member Lip-Bu Tan, an industry veteran, left over what he considered a bloated workforce, risk-averse culture, and lagging AI strategy (Max A. Cherney/Reuters)
Cerebras launches the "world's fastest" AI inference service with "GPU-impossible performance", costing 10+ cents per million tokens, to rival Nvidia (Mike Wheatley/SiliconANGLE)
Instagram now lets users add text to photos right from its post editor, rather than needing a separate app, and add more photos as stickers on top of a photo (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Meta says it will shut down Meta Spark, its third-party AR tools and content platform that launched in 2017, effective January 14, 2025, angering some creators (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
